00050 typedef miScalar (*function)(miScalar, miScalar, miScalar, miScalar);
00051 
00052 enum types
00053 {
00054 kBox,
00055 kTriangle,
00056 kGaussian,
00057 kSinc,
00058 kDisk,
00059 kCatmullRom,
00060 kMitchell,

00073 inline
00074 miScalar box( miScalar x, miScalar y, miScalar w, miScalar h )
00075 {
00076    w *= 0.5f;
00077    h *= 0.5f;
00078    if (x >= -w && x <= w && y >= -h && y <= h)
00079       return 1.0f;
00080    else return 0.0f;
00081 }
00082 
00083 
00084 inline
00085 miScalar triangle( miScalar x, miScalar y, miScalar w, miScalar h )
00086 {
00087    w *= 0.5f;
00088    h *= 0.5f;
00089    if (x >= -w && x <= w && y >= -h && y <= h)
00090       return ( ( w - math<float>::fabs(x) ) * ( h - math<float>::fabs(y) ) );
00091    else return 0.0f;
00092 }
00093 
00094 
00095 
00096 inline
00097 miScalar gaussian( miScalar x, miScalar y, miScalar w, miScalar h )
00098 {
00099 //     miScalar d2 = (x*x+y*y);
00100 //     miScalar d = math<float>::sqrt( d2 );
00101 //     miScalar w2 = 0.5f * (w*w + h*h);
00102 //     miScalar w = math<float>::sqrt( w2 );
00103 //     if (d > w)
00104 //        return 0.0f;
00105 //     else
00106 //        return math<float>::exp(-d2) - math<float>::exp(-w2);
00107    
00108    // The above version falls faster than the one used by the 3.2 spec
00109    //   PRMan and RenderDotC.  Since all three match exactly, might as
00110    //   well change to the code below:
00111    x *= 2.0f / w;
00112    y *= 2.0f / h;
00113 
00114    return math<float>::exp( -2.0f * ( x * x + y * y ) );
00115 }
00116 
00117 
00118 inline
00119 miScalar sinc( miScalar x, miScalar y, miScalar w, miScalar h )
00120 {
00121         //RtFloat d;
00122         //
00123         //d = sqrt(x*x+y*y);
00124         //
00125         //if(d!=0)
00126         //      return(sin(RI_PI*d)/(RI_PI*d));
00127         //else
00128         //      return(1.0);
00129 
00130         // The above is an un-windowed sinc, below is a windowed sinc
00131         //   function similar in shape to what PRMan 3.9 uses.
00132         // tburge 5-28-01
00133 
00134         /* Modified version of the RI Spec 3.2 sinc filter to be
00135          *   windowed with a positive lobe of a cosine which is half
00136          *   of a cosine period.  
00137          */
00138 
00139         /* Uses a -PI to PI cosine window. */
00140         if ( x != 0.0f )
00141         {
00142            x *= (miScalar)M_PI;
00143            x = math<float>::cos( 0.5f * x / w ) * math<float>::sin( x ) / x;
00144         }
00145         else
00146         {
00147            x = 1.0f;
00148         }
00149         if ( y != 0.0 )
00150         {
00151            y *= (miScalar)M_PI;
00152            y = math<float>::cos( 0.5f * y / h ) * math<float>::sin( y ) / y;
00153         }
00154         else
00155         {
00156            y = 1.0f;
00157         }
00158 
00159         /* This is a square separable filter and is the 2D Fourier
00160          * transform of a rectangular box outlining a lowpass bandwidth
00161         * filter in the frequency domain.
00162         */ 
00163         return x*y;
00164 }
00165 
00166 
00167 inline
00168 miScalar disk( miScalar x, miScalar y, miScalar w, miScalar h )
00169 {
00170    miScalar xx = x * x;
00171    miScalar yy = y * y;
00172    w *= 0.5f;
00173    h *= 0.5f;
00174 
00175    miScalar d = ( xx ) / ( w * w ) + ( yy ) / ( h * h );
00176    if ( d < 1.0f )
00177    {
00178       return 1.0f;
00179    }
00180    else
00181    {
00182       return 0.0f;
00183    }
00184 }
00185 
00186 
00187 
00188 inline
00189 miScalar catmullrom( miScalar x, miScalar y, miScalar w, miScalar h )
00190 {
00191    miScalar d2 = x * x + y * y; /* d*d */
00192    miScalar d = sqrt( d2 ); /* distance from origin */
00193    
00194    if ( d < 1.0f )
00195       return ( 1.5f * d * d2 - 2.5f * d2 + 1.0f );
00196    else if ( d < 2.0f )
00197       return ( -d * d2 * 0.5f + 2.5f * d2 - 4.0f * d + 2.0f );
00198    else
00199       return 0.0f;
00200 }
00201 
00202 
00203 inline
00204 miScalar mitchell( miScalar x, miScalar y, miScalar w, miScalar h )
00205 {
00206    static const miScalar B = 1.0f / 3.0f;
00207    static const miScalar C = 1.0f / 3.0f;
00208    static const miScalar D = 1.0f / 6.0f;
00209    
00210    x /= w;
00211    y /= h;
00212    miScalar t = math<float>::sqrt(x*x + y*y);
00213    if (t > 2.0f) return 0.0f;
00214    else
00215    {
00216       if (t > 1.0f)
00217          return ((( (-B - 6.0f*C) * t + (6.0f*B + 30.0f*C) ) * t +
00218                   (-12.0f*B - 48.0f*C) ) * t + (8.0f*B + 24.0f*C)) * D;
00219       else
00220          return (( (12.0f - 9.0f*B - 6.0f*C) * t +
00221                    (-18.0f + 12.0f*B + 6.0f*C) ) * t * t +
00222                  (6.0f - 2.0f*B)) * D;
00223    }
00224 }
00225 
00226 
00227 
00228 inline
00229 miScalar  bessel( miScalar x, miScalar y, miScalar w, miScalar h )
00230 {
00231    miScalar xx = x * x;
00232    miScalar yy = y * y;
00233    
00234    w *= 0.5f;
00235    h *= 0.5f;
00236    
00237    miScalar t = ( xx ) / ( w * w ) + ( yy ) / ( h * h );
00238    if ( t < 1.0f )
00239    {
00240       miScalar d = xx + yy;
00241       if ( d > 0.0f )
00242       {
00243          d = math<float>::sqrt( d );
00244          /* Half cosine window. */
00245          t = math<float>::cos( 0.5f * (miScalar)M_PI * math<float>::sqrt( t ) );
00246          // j1() is a math.h bessel function
00247          return t * 2.0f * (miScalar)j1( ((miScalar)M_PI) * d ) / d;
00248       }
00249       else
00250       {
00251          return (miScalar)M_PI;
00252       }
00253    }
00254    else
00255    {
00256       return 0.0f;
00257    }
00258 }
00259 
00260 // for lanczos...
00261 inline miScalar sinc( miScalar t )
00262 {
00263    if ( t != 0.0f )
00264    {
00265       t *= (miScalar)M_PI;
00266       return math<float>::cos( 0.5f * t ) * math<float>::sin( t ) / t;
00267    }
00268    else
00269    {
00270       return 1.0f;
00271    }
00272 }
00273 
00274 // 2 lobbed lanczos
00275 inline
00276 miScalar  lanczos2( miScalar x, miScalar y, miScalar w, miScalar h )
00277 {
00278    x /= w;
00279    y /= h;
00280    miScalar t = math<float>::sqrt(x*x + y*y);
00281    if ( t < 2 ) return sinc(t)*sinc(t/2);
00282    else return 0.0f;
00283 }
00284 
00285 // 3 lobbed lanczos
00286 inline
00287 miScalar  lanczos( miScalar x, miScalar y, miScalar w, miScalar h )
00288 {
00289    x /= w;
00290    y /= h;
00291    miScalar t = math<float>::sqrt(x*x + y*y);
00292    if ( t < 3 ) return sinc(t)*sinc(t/3);
00293    else return 0.0f;
00294 }
00295 
00296 
00297 inline
00298 miScalar  hann( miScalar x, miScalar y, miScalar w, miScalar h,
00299                 miScalar n = 3,
00300                 miScalar a = 0.5f )
00301 {
00302    x /= w;
00303    y /= h;
00304    miScalar t = math<float>::sqrt(x*x + y*y);
00305    n -= 1;
00306    if ( t < n*0.5f )
00307    {
00308       return a + (1.0f - a) * math<float>::cos( 2 * (miScalar)M_PI * t / n );
00309    }
00310    else
00311    {
00312       return 0.0f;
00313    }
00314 }
00315 
00316 
00317 inline
00318 miScalar  hamming( miScalar x, miScalar y, miScalar w, miScalar h,
00319                    miScalar n = 3 )
00320 {
00321    return hann( x, y, w, h, n, 0.54f );
00322 }

00326 inline
00327 function fromEnumeration( const types flt )
00328 {
00329    switch( flt )
00330    {
00331       case mr::filter::kGaussian:
00332          return mr::filter::gaussian;
00333       case mr::filter::kTriangle:
00334          return mr::filter::triangle;
00335       case mr::filter::kMitchell:
00336          return mr::filter::mitchell;
00337       case mr::filter::kLanczos2:
00338          return mr::filter::lanczos2;
00339       case mr::filter::kLanczos3:
00340          return mr::filter::lanczos;
00341       case mr::filter::kDisk:
00342          return mr::filter::disk;
00343       case mr::filter::kSinc:
00344          return mr::filter::sinc;
00345       case mr::filter::kCatmullRom:
00346          return mr::filter::catmullrom;
00347       case mr::filter::kBessel:
00348          return mr::filter::bessel;
00349       case mr::filter::kBox:
00350       default:
00351          return mr::filter::box;
00352    }
00353 }
